data.title: EETS Layfolks Catechism Publicationsorig118earluoft
data.meta_description:
EETS Layfolks Catechism Publicationsorig118earluoft - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. The document provides an introduction to four medieval catechetical texts: the English and Latin versions of Archbishop Thoresby's Instruction for Parish Priests and a Wycliffite adaptation of the same. It discusses three early English reformers who sought to improve clergy education and discipline: 

1) Archbishop John Peckham of Canterbury, who convened the Council of Lambeth in 1281 to address issues like pluralism among clergy. 

2) Archbishop John de Thoresby of York, whose Lay Folks' Catechism was likely inspired by Peckham's constitutions. 

3) John Wyclif, whose Wycliffite adaptation of Thoresby's catechism was
